title: Figma Launches Three AI-Powered Image Editing Tools, Eliminating Need for External Design Software

paragraphs.content: Figma unveiled three new AI-powered image editing tools on December 10, 2025—**Erase object**, **Isolate object**, and **Expand image**—designed to enable precise visual edits directly within the platform without requiring exports to external software.The tools use AI models optimized for granular editing rather than text prompts, addressing a longstanding workflow friction point where designers must juggle between Figma and applications like Photoshop or Canva.These features integrate into a newly consolidated image-editing toolbar that groups background removal, cropping, annotations, and AI capabilities into a unified interface.The announcement represents a significant competitive move as Figma works to match capabilities long offered by established rivals in the design software market.

paragraphs.content: The new tools are currently available in **Figma Design** and **Figma Draw** for users on Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plans with AI enabled, requiring a Full seat.Figma has committed to a broader rollout across its platform throughout 2026, signaling confidence in these features as core workflow components.The launch coincides with Adobe integrating similar object removal capabilities into ChatGPT, where Figma serves as a partner, though the interoperability of Figma's new tools within that ecosystem remains unclear.Industry analysts view this release as Figma positioning itself as a comprehensive visual design hub rather than a wireframing tool alone.

sections.title: How the Three Tools Streamline Image Editing Within a Single Canvas

paragraphs.content: The **Erase object** tool employs an upgraded lasso selector that allows designers to remove unwanted elements from images while the AI intelligently preserves surrounding background details, lighting, shadows, and color characteristics.Users apply no text prompts—instead, they select regions directly on the canvas and the system fills in the gaps seamlessly, maintaining visual consistency.The **Isolate object** feature extends this capability by allowing designers to select and separate specific subjects for independent manipulation, enabling repositioning without disrupting the overall composition.Once isolated, users access sidebar controls to fine-tune properties like lighting, shadow intensity, color temperature, and focus depth, offering precise control over individual elements.

paragraphs.content: The **Expand image** tool addresses a critical pain point in responsive design by intelligently extending image backgrounds to new aspect ratios without distortion or loss of context.This capability proves especially valuable for marketers and product teams who need to adapt hero images, product shots, or promotional assets across multiple formats—converting a square social media image to a landscape web banner, for instance.Figma's consolidated toolbar places the frequently used **Remove background** feature prominently, recognizing that background removal remains one of the platform's most common operations among designers.The unified toolbar design reduces friction by keeping all image editing capabilities accessible without menu diving or external tool launches.

sections.title: Competitive Positioning and Industry Implications for Design Workflows

paragraphs.content: Figma is directly addressing years of competitive disadvantage, as Adobe and Canva have offered object removal capabilities for several years prior to this announcement.However, industry observers note that Figma's approach prioritizes precision and designer control over generation-focused alternatives, emphasizing no-prompt, lasso-based selection workflows tailored to professional visual refinement.The consolidation of these tools into a single toolbar signals Figma's broader strategy to eliminate "multi-app chaos" by embedding increasingly sophisticated capabilities directly into the design canvas.This positioning appeals particularly to teams seeking faster iterations without dependency on specialized image editing software or external design resources.

paragraphs.content: For marketers and content teams, the immediate benefit is reduced turnaround time on asset variations—teams can now create test-specific formats and mockup refinements in-house rather than requesting design team support for every minor adjustment.Figma's release notes from January 15, 2026, contextualize these tools within a larger 2025 momentum, noting the company deployed over 150 features throughout the year, signaling sustained investment in platform capabilities.While no major adoption metrics or user feedback have emerged as of mid-January 2026, early coverage from design-focused outlets emphasizes the workflow liberation these tools enable.The planned 2026 expansion across Figma's broader product ecosystem suggests the company intends these image editing capabilities as foundational to its long-term platform vision.
